title: What universities in the UK are respected similarly to OxBridge worldwide? - Quora
tags: Colleges and Universities in the United Kingdom

response.answer_text: Oxford and Cambridge (collectively referred to as “Oxbridge”) are pretty much the only two “general” universities with a worldwide reputation - that’s to say, well regarded no matter what subject is being considered. There are others, however, that have an excellent reputation in specific subjects. Some more specific than others. LSE (London School of Economics), for, well, EconomicsManchester for materials science (anything to do with graphene)Sheffield for planting design (ie landscape design)Southampton Solent for Yacht and Powercraft Design [Thanks Gill Bullen for this suggestion]

Oxbridge are definitely our most well known universities in the UK. However in terms of which universities are the best we have a group of them called Russell Group Universities, (bit like Ivy League) of which Oxbridge are a part. These are: University of BirminghamUniversity of BristolUniversity of CambridgeCardiff UniversityDurham UniversityUniversity of EdinburghUniversity of ExeterUniversity of GlasgowImperial College LondonKing's College LondonUniversity of LeedsUniversity of LiverpoolLSE (London School of Economics & Political Science)University of ManchesterNewcastle UniversityUniversity of NottinghamUniversity of OxfordQueen Mary University of LondonQueen's University BelfastUniversity of SheffieldUniversity of SouthamptonUCL (University College London)University of WarwickUniversity of York
